00011 /* NOTE: If you add or remove any items here, update "debugOn()" in Debug.cpp
00012  * to reflect the modifications.
00013  */
00014 enum LevelDefinitions
00015 {
00016         /* Graceful recovery from these kinds of errors are impossible; these are
00017          * show-stoppers and must be fixed ASAP.  This message should immediately
00018          * be followed by a call to exit().
00019          */
00020         CRITICAL_LEVEL = 0,
00021 
00022         /* Graceful recovery from these kinds of errors are possible, though the
00023          * game cannot proceed forward from this point.  This includes missing
00024          * files and resources, corrupt data files, etc.  The programmer can at
00025          * least give useful information about the cause of the error before the
00026          * program bails.
00027          */
00028         ERROR_LEVEL,
00029 
00030         /* Expected but non-critical files and data, like those found in config
00031          * files, cannot be found or loaded.  Defaults can usually be used and
00032          * the game can continue from this point, but a programmer or developer
00033          * should look at the issue (things missing in DEBUG builds may be okay,
00034          * but this should be resolved by the time a RELEASE build is made).
00035          */
00036         WARNING_LEVEL,
00037 
00038         /* Hints and reminders to programmers/developers can be made at this
00039          * level.  This may include messages such as "FIXME: player's sprite is
00040          * not being warped to the correct position..."  No recovery need be made
00041          * for this error level.
00042          */
00043         SUGGESTION_LEVEL,
00044 
00045         /* When testing to ensure things are loading/working correctly, use these
00046          * values.  Add to the TOP of the VERBOSE_LEVEL# list so older not-as-
00047          * important debugging can be ignored while you work out the "new problems"
00048          * and avoid excessive outputs (warning: all of these VERBOSE levels
00049          * generate a LOT of output (several KB to MB).  Use sparingly.
00050          */
00051         VERBOSE_LEVEL4,
00052         VERBOSE_LEVEL3,
00053         VERBOSE_LEVEL2,
00054         VERBOSE_LEVEL1,
00055 
00056         /* Must be the last item in the enum so we know how many items have been
00057          * defined here.
00058          */
00059         NUM_DEBUG_DEFINITIONS
00060 };
00061

00064  * Turn on debugging output when showDebug is > level.
00065  */
00066 void debugOn(std::ostream& os, const int& level);
00067

00069 /* Function: debugOff
00070  * Turn off debugging output.
00071  */
00072 void debugOff(std::ostream& os);

00075 /* Macro: mon_assert
00076  * Makes sure an expression is true.
00077  * If not, the expression and the location of it is printed.
00078  */
00079 #define mon_assert(e) { if (!(e)) { Monday_assert(#e, __FILE__, __LINE__); } }
00080 
00081 /* Macro: printlog
00082  * Prints a message along with the location from where it was called.
00083  */
00084 #define printlog(msg) Monday_log(msg, __FILE__, __LINE__);
00085 
00086 /* Function: Monday_assert
00087  * If condition does not evaluate true, dump file and line where
00088  * condition failed, and exit program.
00089  */
00090 void Monday_assert(const char* e, const char* file, int line);
00091 
00092 /* Function: Monday_log
00093  * Display the given message along with the current filename and line.
00094  */
00095 void Monday_log(const std::string& e, const char* file, int line);
00096

00098 /* Display a debugging message at a certain debugging level */
00099 void Monday_out(const u32 &debugLevel, std::ostream& os, const char* msg, ...);

00103 void Show_attributes(std::ostream& os, Attributes& attributes);
